title: Help with Identifying a Font
content:
I need help with identifying this band font. It's similar to the Millenium font. But unfortunately I can't find anything that is similar to it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413143222im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adema_6416.jpg)
author: standardsdt

comments.content: I don't have a perfect match for this one. If I have to reproduce it, I would probably start from [Eurostile Extended Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413143222/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/eurostile) (the only difference I can quickly identify is /D counter internal shape) and customize it (cutting some crossbars). For the rest, it's very [Typodermic Ray Larabie](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413143222/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Typodermic/), some of his fonts could fit almost perfectly: [Sui Generis](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413143222/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/sui-generis), [Pirulen](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413143222/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/pirulen)... Another option would be to have a look to [Techno \> Sci-Fi](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413143222/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303) and [Techno \> Various](http://web.archive.org/web/20130413143222/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=304) to pick a good base font to customize or, may be, a match.
